author: pipermerriam
content: FYI, if you applied during the first cohort and did not get in, and you want to be considered for the second cohort, you will need to apply again.

author: dev1054
content:
Hey <@!364458974906548225> , can I DM you regarding a few questions on CDAP?

author: pipermerriam
content: I encourage you to ask any questions here on this channel  that don't have a specific reason to be kept private. Anything that doesn't fit that is fine to ask in DM

author: dev1054
content:
I wanted to understand what opportunities open up once a person is successfully able deliver the project during the program?

One obvious thing is : The person is able to generate massive Proof of Work.
I hope this helps that person to land a full time job with the teams ?

Are there other things as well ?

author: dev1054
content:
Some context : I am currently a Backend dev and planning to switch into Blockchain space.
To get a taste of how it would be like : I am currently working as a part time in a project in Polkadot ecosystem.

Please forgive me if this comes out rude. I do not mean it to be that way. I am just trying to gather as much info I can.
In super frank terms, I am trying to figure out answer to this .

Part-time in Polkadot --> Full time in Polkadot --> Eventually start something of my own
VS
CDAP --> (What opportunities/learnings are possible here)  --> Eventually start something of my own

author: pipermerriam
content: <@385832319312986112> have you looked through the development updates and notes from the first cohort?

author: pipermerriam
content: That should give you some context for what CDAP involves

author: pipermerriam
content: Spot on. The demonstration of your ability to do the work is one of the intended results. I can't make guarantees about getting you a job but I'll open all the doors I can.
